column1: The United States reported more than 3 million new COVID-19 cases alone this November. Cases are at record highs and hospitals are at capacity.   We all have a role to play to slow the spread. Wear a mask. Social distance. Do your part and let’s fight this.

With the added stress of the holiday season approaching we need to provide robust funding to help people struggling with mental health and substance use disorders. We cannot let families struggling with addiction become casualties of COVID. https://t.co/PDzP0n4WOX

COVID-19 cases are spiking at record highs and more than 45 million people have filed for unemployment during the pandemic. It’s time to stop playing politics with people’s lives and deliver the assistance families need to stay afloat during this crisis.  https://t.co/Zd2rCaAsI1 https://t.co/AxTZV2CLLX

President Trump’s tweet for COVID relief was a call on Mitch McConnell’s failed leadership. Today I joined @SenSchumer in New York City to call Congress back to the negotiating table. https://t.co/XwE63S9bu1

This week I was a guest on @TakeoutPodcast with @MajorCBS discussing vital VA coverage for vets exposed to toxic burn pits the future of COVID relief under President-elect Biden and the need for a peaceful transition. Listen here.     https://t.co/9o0IALengP

For months public health officials have warned that the changing seasons could put more Americans at risk for the seasonal flu and COVID-19. @SenTinaSmith and I want to ensure that we’re proactive in ensuring all Americans receive this year’s flu vaccine. https://t.co/68Q3120tei

In the face of tragedy on Sept. 11 we saw the best of America in the first responders firefighters police officers and others who bravely stepped up to support our communities.  Today we see the same selfless strong and undaunted spirit in the face of the COVID crisis. https://t.co/Ru8GreP8MG
In Syracuse I met with local childcare providers to bring attention to one of the most critical issues related to our COVID response and recovery: child care. https://t.co/JO8rtd2DJc

This morning I visited the @Trudeau_Inst in Saranac Lake. During this pandemic the Institute has focused their important research efforts on the coronavirus and a COVID-19 vaccine.   Thanks for having me! https://t.co/LWRNIVun31
In Rochester I joined @RepJoeMorelle and local leaders to call for direct federal relief funding to local governments as they respond to and recover from the COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/69QtRAzaZG

The COVID-19 crisis has left state and local governments facing rising costs and plummeting revenues. In Buffalo I joined @MayorByronBrown and local leaders to urge the Senate to pass legislation to give our state and local governments direct federal relief. https://t.co/D69BA5g3dZ

State and local governments have exhausted their resources. The COVID-19 crisis has left them facing rising costs and plummeting revenues.    And much of the economic relief that we passed earlier this year is going to run out very soon.   The Senate needs to act now. https://t.co/3Jnwgq1pyw

This morning in Albany I visited the Arbor Hill Food Pantry @TrinityAlbanyNY. They’ve been a critical lifeline during the hunger crisis caused by COVID19 and I’m so grateful for the work they do. Thanks for hosting me this morning! https://t.co/aVNoVa3OPy
I spoke at today’s @SenFinance hearing on the urgent need for a comprehensive national paid family leave program as we navigate the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/qRWw2Yh0GO

At last week’s Aging Committee hearing I asked an expert:  “If workers—especially nursing home and health care workers—had access to comprehensive paid leave would it help to slow the spread of the coronavirus?”  Here’s what she said: https://t.co/HvVrzSCN1H

The coronavirus outbreak has only amplified the country's gun violence epidemic. It’s time for commonsense solutions to a problem that affects all our communities. I'll continue fighting to keep New Yorkers safe from gun violence as we fight this pandemic. https://t.co/L7svAy4XTt

Right now millions of Americans are seeking food assistance amid the COVID-19 crisis. We shouldn’t allow anyone in this country to go hungry. I sent a letter to Senate leaders urging Congress to increase and expand SNAP benefits in the next economic relief package. https://t.co/hdiFmB8nFn

I am thrilled that the Safeguarding America's First Responders Act legislation that I pushed with @SenBooker @SenatorMenendez and @SenBlumenthal to help the families of public safety officers who fall to COVID-19 passed the Senate today. https://t.co/SvRNDH7Eyj

Will go LIVE with @RepUnderwood tomorrow at 2:30PM ET. Excited to discuss our legislation to start a Health Force that would recruit and train thousands of Americans to directly support the COVID19 response. Watch at https://t.co/Q0JINZSxAa https://t.co/fipjKevVIJ

With many challenges in our food supply chain during COVID-19 I’m working to better ensure that food doesn’t go to waste and that families across New York can keep food on the table. https://t.co/SOFpBVdGOc

Direct federal relief for local governments is absolutely critical as they grapple with the economic fallout from the COVID-19 pandemic. My colleagues and I are doing everything we can to ensure that it is included the next economic relief package.   https://t.co/C3i2PK2cJI
TODAY @ 3:30PM ET: Joining @ABetterBalance to discuss how we can best protect and support working families during COVID-19.   Register here: https://t.co/ABmf4dlkZH https://t.co/AtmanPv2RO

Looking forward to joining @ABetterBalance tomorrow to discuss how we can better support working families during the COVID-19 crisis. Hope you’ll join us: https://t.co/ABmf4dlkZH https://t.co/mp44pyhCAp

I’m partnering with @SenatorBennet on legislation to start a Health Force that will recruit and train thousands of recently unemployed Americans to directly support the nation's COVID19 response. We were proud come together to announce this legislation (virtually!)—check it out: https://t.co/kMDCAVBcYK
The first step towards slowing the spread of #COVID19 is to ensure that everyone can stay home when they need to—that’s why we need national paid leave. https://t.co/4iiWpupCTA

The next COVID relief bill should include emergency funding and voting mechanisms to ensure that the constitutional rights of all Americans are protected during this unprecedented public health crisis. Read: https://t.co/EQ681lvIRX

In these uncertain times my office and I want to keep you updated. We’ve put together a set of resources to help New Yorkers navigate #COVID19 from health care resources to information around economic relief. Find it here: https://t.co/9U8mbV0ias

I’m urging @amazon and @Walmart to waive delivery fees and minimum order requirements for SNAP recipients. With many New Yorkers turning to delivery services amidst the coronavirus pandemic these companies should remove this undue burden from our most vulnerable families. https://t.co/dw0cdPeUpq

As part of a bipartisan challenge I’m launching with @SenTedCruz I sent @defazios pizzas to front line medical staff staying at the Heroes Landing in Albany New York.   Now I’m calling on @SenBooker @LtGovHochulNY and @DavidChang to take part! #CombatCOVID19Challenge https://t.co/9k9uvlwQeD

Paid family and sick leave are two of the most important things we can put in place to help stop the spread of #COVID19—that’s why I’m fighting to get it included in the next relief package. https://t.co/4iiWpupCTA

In these uncertain times my office and I want to keep you updated. We’ve put together a set of resources to help New Yorkers navigate #COVID19 from health care resources to information around economic relief.   Find it here: https://t.co/9U8mbVhT20
If your small business has been impacted by #COVID19 the emergency relief package can help you. Here’s how: https://t.co/onK9pTIzYa
Looking forward to holding a tele-town hall with @AARPNY tomorrow to discuss the Coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/ZrUBwWNbeb

According to recent reporting states with significantly fewer cases of #COVID19 than New York are having requests for medical supplies from the federal stockpile filled completely while New York’s hospitals wait. I’m demanding answers and transparency from President Trump: https://t.co/uzMdbn8q3I
If you’ve recently lost your job due to #COVID19 the emergency relief package will help you. I’ll tell you everything you need to know about changes to unemployment insurance: https://t.co/kpg8FRg7XU

New Yorkers: As we navigate #COVID19 I want to assure you that we’re in this together. My office has put together a set of resources—with information on the relief package that just passed Congress—that we'll update for the duration of the pandemic: https://t.co/9U8mbV0ias

My team and I put together a set of resources as New Yorkers navigate the #COVID19 pandemic with guides to the coronavirus economic relief package and how it can help you. We'll update and share as we have new information: https://t.co/9U8mbV0ias
Many Americans are soon to get a cash payment from the coronavirus relief package. Wondering if you’re one of them? I’ll tell you everything you need to know. https://t.co/lpqc0nEy6K
The coronavirus relief package will give many Americans a one time cash payment to help get through this crisis. Here’s what you need to know about it: https://t.co/lpqc0nEy6K

I just cast my vote for the coronavirus economic package. With this package New Yorkers have more help on the way. It will deliver a surge of protective equipment and resources to New York hospitals and first responders and put real dollars in New Yorkers' pockets.
New York State is working hard to keep you safe during #COVID19. Please keep up to date with all of the latest news and resources by going to: https://t.co/MKqGWLGcqJ

.@NYGovCuomo and his team have put together some great resources for updates on #COVID19 in New York State. I highly recommend that you sign up to get email alerts and stay informed: https://t.co/z49aguumvZ

A growing number of coronavirus cases are set to overwhelm hospital capacity across New York State posing another crisis. We must work to fully support our hospitals and public health systems. @SenSchumer and I are urging FEMA and the Army Corps to act as quickly as possible. https://t.co/3qOnOrbTtC
New Yorkers: Stay informed and up to date with the latest information and resources on #COVID19. https://t.co/m0HEygoG98

As we speak Americans across the country are already confronting economic emergencies because of the #Coronavirus pandemic. That's why it's urgent that the PAID Leave Act be included in the next economic relief package passed by the Senate. Watch LIVE: https://t.co/fsYeX3xXj4

I have joined @PattyMurray and @rosadelauro in introducing a comprehensive emergency paid sick leave and paid family leave bill—called the PAID Leave Act—in response to the worsening #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/gTVMKczIwF
Our families and workers are on the front lines of this #COVID19 crisis. They deserve our unwavering support. No half measures. https://t.co/PYSabnLWGf
I’m on the Senate floor to call on Congress to put our families and workers first in the Coronavirus Economic Relief Package. Watch live: https://t.co/KYkrD4HGJb

If we had national paid sick days and paid family leave every American worker could have the peace of mind that they would be able to care for themselves or a loved one during this public health crisis. #COVID19 https://t.co/hhr1fok7Rb

With the #COVID19 outbreak many American workers will choose between a paycheck and caring for themselves or a loved one. As the Senate considers an economic relief bill @SenKamalaHarris @SenBooker and I are calling to include paid family & sick leave. https://t.co/S0QJ1jGMqm

Every worker should have two weeks of paid sick leave. It's the right thing to do for our communities and for our economy especially as the country grapples with this #COVID19 outbreak.    https://t.co/BcQDVNbxzD

Offering paid sick leave to every American worker would allow them to care for themselves and their families during this #COVID19 outbreak.   It would help keep our communities safe. https://t.co/1UzxmpK1Dx

As multiple cases of coronavirus have now been confirmed in New York State I want to assure New Yorkers that my office is working to develop a robust and strategic response to keep people safe. https://t.co/z52rGbXH4n

As we hear more updates about the spread of #Coronavirus in New York and around the country make sure to protect yourself and others from getting sick.   You can find the guidance you need at @CDCgov: https://t.co/PH4QC6HE22   and @NYDOH: https://t.co/H8aNElK36X
